meanings.definition: To have reached the highest point or culmination.
meanings.sent1: The tree culmed at the top of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The hiker culmed the mountain after a long climb.
meanings.sent3: The race culmed at the finish line with a photo finish.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement culmed when she won the award.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room culmed as the winner was announced.

meanings.definition: To have formed into a peak or ridge.
meanings.sent1: The snow culmed on top of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The artist culmed the clay into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The whipped cream culmed on top of the hot chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The waves culmed at the edge of the shore.
meanings.sent5: The icing culmed on the cake, creating a perfect peak.

meanings.definition: To have grown to full height or maturity.
meanings.sent1: The sunflower culmed in the summer sun.
meanings.sent2: The child culmed into a responsible adult.
meanings.sent3: The puppy culmed into a big, playful dog.
meanings.sent4: The plant culmed in the rich soil of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The oak tree culmed over many years, becoming a majestic presence in the forest.
